page.title: 08Hatherop's Artesian Well
page.content: An artesian well is formed when a layer of non porous rock has water trapped at high pressure beneath it. If a hole is drilled through the rock then the water will rise up the bore hole .Should the pressure be great enough the water will be forced high into the air. In Hatherop there is an artesian well.It was drilled around the turn of the century . The pressure was so great that the water created a fountain forty foot high. Several engineers tried without success to pump the water around the farms and estate houses. The man who succeded was named Godwin and his water pump company still flourishes in Quenington . The water was not popular with the housewives for it contains a large {continued on page 9
